item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Monday, December 30, 2024 at 8:20 AM UTC
item.description:
1. From Pegasus to Predator – The evolution of commercial spyware on iOS [video] (151 points | 41 comments)
2. Pigment Mixing into Digital Painting (221 points | 38 comments)
3. KAG – Knowledge Graph RAG Framework (62 points | 12 comments)
4. The Cody Computer (126 points | 12 comments)
5. Nikon reveals a lens that captures wide and telephoto images simultaneously (38 points | 9 comments)
6. PolyDye: Full color printer mod for Marlin 3D printers (51 points | 8 comments)
7. The Zombocom Problem (148 points | 37 comments)
8. Archibald Low's ‘ruthlessly imaginative’ 1925 predictions come true, mostly (31 points | 11 comments)
9. Build a working game of Tetris in Conway's Game of Life (2014) (191 points | 19 comments)
10. Rod Serling on Doomsday (36 points | 6 comments)
11. Overloading the lambda abstraction in Haskell (2022) (10 points | discuss)
12. Neuters: Lightweight front end to Reuters News (33 points | 13 comments)
13. Single cigarette takes 20 minutes off life expectancy, study finds (27 points | 25 comments)
14. The last Inca bridge master (93 points | 16 comments)
15. Show HN: Chorus, a Mac app that lets you chat with a bunch of AIs at once (83 points | 30 comments)
16. Trying to use Bluesky without getting burned again (179 points | 308 comments)
17. WebGL Fluid Simulation (402 points | 52 comments)
18. Jimmy Carter has died (1024 points | 578 comments)
19. Is Iceland getting ready to join the EU? (238 points | 420 comments)
20. Issues with object-oriented programming in Guile (5 points | discuss)
21. The history of twisted-pair Ethernet [video] (87 points | 10 comments)
22. Brave Care Has Closed (47 points | 83 comments)
23. Faster CI with Selective Testing (34 points | 32 comments)
24. Breaking NATO Radio Encryption [video] (107 points | 26 comments)
25. OpenAI’s board, paraphrased: ‘All we need is unimaginable sums of money’ (195 points | 190 comments)
26. Intel's $475M error: the silicon behind the Pentium division bug (353 points | 107 comments)
27. Measuring and Understanding LLM Identity Confusion (10 points | 1 comment)
28. Melbourne Train Control System is running on a hardware emulated PDP11 (113 points | 28 comments)
29. Can LLMs accurately recall the Bible? (190 points | 123 comments)
30. Show HN: WIP NandToTetris Emulator in pure C – logic gates to ALU to CPU to PC (24 points | 10 comments)
item.guid: Hacker News Top Stories: Monday, December 30, 2024 at 8:20 AM UTC
